content:
Hey @T-compiler/meeting! I've created a public Google calendar that you should be able to subscribe yourselves to:

https://calendar.google.com/calendar/b/1?cid=NnU1cnJ0Y2U2bHJ0djA3cGZpM2RhbWdqdXNAZ3JvdXAuY2FsZW5kYXIuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbQ

It contains all regular meetings I know of. @T-compiler members, I will happily add you as administrators if you would like to be able to add events to the calendar yourselves. Alternatively, feel free to ask me to add things.

I'll add a link to this calendar in the compiler-team repository. Please let me know if you have any problems subscribing to it!
Is it different from the calendar that we had before?
I'm not aware of a previous calendar...? There is a Rust Community Calendar, and I had various calendar events that were on my personal calendar
I moved those events to this calendar though
This one should be something you can subscribe publicly without getting the details of my dentist appointments =)
Is there a way to subscribe w/out a google account?
@davidtwco oh, does that not work?
good feedback =) I thought it would be some kind of public link
I'm open to suggestions for other places to host the calendar, or advice on how to make google produce a standard ICS thing or whatever
I did some brief, well, google searching, and this was the most promising link I found in that short time

I'm not aware of a previous calendar...? There is a Rust Community Calendar, and I had various calendar events that were on my personal calendar

well I definitely have compiler meetings on my calendar some way or the other
this includes the regular weekly one and the bi-weekly steering one
@nagisa yeah those were just events that I created in my personal calendar and had added you to the invite list. I moved them over to the new one, so you should (I think) see no difference.
got it.
@nagisa or you could just remove everything and follow this new calendar
I’ve… no idea how to remove stuff from my calendar :D
From my brief research, I can't see a way to subscribe to a google calendar w/out an account (perhaps unless it is explicitly shared via email).
Yeah it seems that the CalDAV API needs authentication
You can see the calendar e.g. at https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=6u5rrtce6lrtv07pfi3damgjus%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=Europe%2FVilnius without logging in (note it is in my tz)...
Ah here it is: https://calendar.google.com/calendar/ical/6u5rrtce6lrtv07pfi3damgjus%40group.calendar.google.com/public/basic.ics

@davidtwco Try this link:

https://calendar.google.com/calendar/ical/6u5rrtce6lrtv07pfi3damgjus%40group.calendar.google.com/public/basic.ics
Oh, I guess @nagisa already published it
I just found it digging about in my gmail settings
I think that should work?
Worked great, thanks.
